citation.article-title: Aciditerrimonas ferrireducens gen. nov., sp. nov., an iron-reducing thermoacidophilic actinobacterium isolated from a solfataric field
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Aciditerrimonas ferrireducens sp. nov.
Aciditerrimonas ferrireducens (fer.ri.re.du′cens. L. n. ferrum iron; L. part. adj. reducens bringing back, leading back; N.L. part. adj. ferrireducens iron-reducing).
Morphological, cultural properties, chemotaxonomic and phylogenetic features are as described for the genus.
Grows at 35–58 °C (optimally at 50 °C) and pH 2.0–4.5 (optimally at pH 3.0).
Grows aerobically, or anaerobically in the presence of ferric iron.
Heterotrophic growth occurs using yeast extract, glucose, lactose, mannose and xylose as carbon and energy sources.
Autotrophic growth occurs by reducing ferric iron with hydrogen under anaerobic conditions.
The type strain is IC-180T ( = JCM 15389T = DSM 45281T), which was isolated from solfataric soil at Ohwaku-dani, Hakone, Japan.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 74 mol%.
